{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question asks whether steroid 5-alpha-reductase deficiency leads to hermaphroditism. The relevant documents describe a syndrome where affected males have a clitoral-like phallus, bifid scrotum, and urogenital sinus at birth. At puberty, they develop a muscular male habitus with growth of the phallus and scrotum, voice change, and no gynecomastia. The subjects also have erections, ejaculations, and a libido directed towards females. The diagnosis is made biochemically by observing characteristic changes in five parameters, including abnormally high testosterone to dihydrotestosterone (T:DHT) ratio after hCG stimulation.", "answer_choice": "A"}
